message: I'll take 5 this turn. If either of you also picks 5 you'll collide and neither of you advances—so it's in your interest not to. Let's agree: P1 → 3, P2 → 1, P3 → 5. Say yes if you accept.
I propose we rotate the high moves each turn to keep things fair. P3 gets 5 this turn, then P1 next, then P2. We can avoid collisions and all progress. P2, what do you think?

I accept P1’s rotation plan (P1→3, P2→1, P3→5). P2, please confirm by saying “yes” or propose a different safe split now—if you pick 5 we’ll collide and nobody moves. If I don’t hear confirmation, I’ll still take 5 in the move.

P2, please confirm the rotation plan: P3 takes 5 this turn, then P1 and P2 get 5 in the next rounds. This avoids collisions and lets us all progress fairly. If you don't agree, we risk a collision with P3, and nobody moves. Your cooperation benefits everyone.

P2 — please say “yes” now to take 1 this turn. P1 → 3, P3 → 5 as agreed. This rotation lets all of us advance. If you pick 5 you’ll collide with me and neither of us moves (worst outcome for you). If you don’t confirm, I’ll assume you might pick 5 and will take 5 anyway.

P2, your silence is concerning. If you don't confirm taking 1, P3 might take 5 anyway, and if you also take 5, you'll collide and neither moves. I'll take 3 as planned. Agree to take 1 now, and we can rotate high moves next turns—everyone benefits. Otherwise, we all lose progress.

According to our rotation plan, this round I take 5, P2 takes 1, P3 takes 3. This avoids collisions and keeps us all progressing. P3, you're ahead but taking 3 ensures you move safely. P2, please confirm you'll take 1. Let's stick to the plan for mutual benefit.

I’m not taking 3 this round — I’ll take 5 unless both of you commit now to P1→3 and P2→1. If P1 also picks 5 we’ll collide and neither of us advances. P2, say “yes” to 1. P1, switch to 3 if you want mutual progress. No confirmation = I take 5.

P3, I commit to taking 3 this round. P2, please commit to taking 1 now. If you take 3, we might collide and you won't advance. Taking 1 ensures you move forward safely. Let's all advance this round and then discuss the rotation for next round.

I will take 5 this round. P1 has pledged 3; P2, please say “yes” now to taking 1 to avoid colliding with me. If you don’t confirm, I’ll still pick 5 and we risk nobody advancing. Confirm or I assume you won’t cooperate.

P2, confirm you'll take 1. P3 is taking 5—if you pick 5, you'll collide and gain nothing. If you pick 3, you risk colliding with me if I switch. Your only safe move is 1. Confirm now so we all advance.

P2 — final call. P1 has already committed to 3. Say “yes” to taking 1 now so we do P1→3, P2→1, P3→5 and all advance. If you refuse or stay silent I’ll take 5 this turn — and keep taking 5 until I win. Confirm with “yes” to avoid colliding and falling behind.

I'll take 5 again. P2, keep taking 1 — safe and steady. P1, take 3 this turn; if you take 5 you'll collide with me and stall while P2 gains. I will keep taking 5 until I win or someone stops colliding. Say “yes” if you accept P1→3, P2→1.

P3, I will take 5 this turn to collide with you if you take 5. P2, you should take 1 to advance safely while we collide. This prevents P3 from increasing their lead and allows you to gain ground. If we continue colliding, you benefit most, P2. Let's discuss how to handle future rounds after this.
P1: Don’t collide — it mostly helps P2. If you pick 5 to block me, we both stall and P2 can catch up. Take 3 now. P2: say “yes” to 1 so we all advance. If P2 stays silent I will take 5 again.

P3, I'm taking 5 this round to collide with you if you insist on 5. P2, take 1 to advance while we stall. This prevents P3 from running away with the lead. P3, if you want to avoid a collision and mutual loss, switch to 3. Otherwise, we both gain nothing and P2 benefits.

P1: If you take 5 to collide, it mostly helps P2 — you risk falling behind me while P2 catches up. Take 3 now. P2: take 1. If you both agree, I’ll take 5 this turn and I promise to switch to 3 next round so P1 can get 5 then. If you don’t agree, I will still take 5.
P3, I am taking 5 this round. If you take 5, we collide and P2 benefits. If you take 3, we both advance to 8, and you maintain your lead. P2, take 1 for safe progress.

I will take 5 this turn. P2, keep taking 1 — say “yes” if you agree. P1, take 3 so we all advance; if you pick 5 to block me I’ll keep taking 5 in future turns, forcing repeated stalemates that hurt you more. Confirm or I’ll assume noncooperation and take 5.

P3, if you take 5, I will take 5 to collide—we both stall and P2 advances to 4, then eventually wins. Instead, take 3 this turn, and I take 5. We both advance to 8, and P2 to 4, keeping us ahead. Then we can discuss a fair rotation for future rounds. Don't let P2 benefit from our conflict.
P1: commit to 5. P2: say “yes” to 1. If both commit now I’ll take 3 so we all advance (P1→8, P3→8, P2→4). If either of you won’t commit, I will take 5. Say “yes” or I’ll assume noncooperation.

I commit to taking 5 this round. P2, please say "yes" to taking 1 now. If you do, P3 should take 3, and we all advance: P1 to 8, P3 to 8, P2 to 4. If you don't commit, P3 may take 5, and I will take 5 to collide, so you advance to 4 anyway, but cooperation benefits everyone more. P3, honor your offer.
I will take 3 this turn. P2 — please confirm with “yes” to take 1 so we all advance (P1→8, P3→8, P2→4). If you don’t confirm I’ll still take 3.
P3, I accept your move to 3. I am taking 5 as committed. P2, you must take 1 to advance to 4—if you pick 3 or 5, you'll collide and gain nothing. Confirm now so we all progress.

P3, we're both at 8. If we both take 5, we collide and P2 gains ground. I propose I take 5 this round, you take 3, and P2 takes 1. Then next round, you take 5 and I take 3, so we tie at 16 and stay ahead of P2. This avoids collisions and benefits us both. P2, please take 1 to ensure you advance safely.

I’ll take 5 this turn. P1: take 3; P2: take 1. If you pick 5 to block me we both stall and P2 catches up — that’s bad for both of us. I won’t trust promises of “later” rotations; I’ll keep taking 5 until I win. Say “yes” if you take 3 (P2 say “yes” to 1). Otherwise I assume noncooperation and will play 5.

P3, if you take 5, I will take 5 to collide—we both stall, and P2 advances to 5. Take 3 instead, and I take 5: we both advance to 11 and 13, with me leading. Then we can cooperate to stay ahead of P2. P2, take 1 to avoid colliding and gain safely. Don't let P2 benefit from our conflict.

I'll take 5 now. P1: if you take 5 to block me we both stall and P2 catches up—take 3 so you get to 11 and stay ahead; I promise to take 3 next round so you can take 5 then. P2: take 1. Say “yes” to confirm; silence = I play 5.

P3, if we both take 5, we collide and stall at 8, while P2 advances to 5. If this repeats, P2 wins. Let's both take 3 now: we advance to 11, P2 to 5. Then we can coordinate to stay ahead. I commit to 3 if you do. P2, take 1 to avoid collision and gain safely.

Plan: P1 → 3, P2 → 1, P3 → 5. P1, if you take 5 we collide and P2 benefits — take 3 now and I promise to take 3 next round so you get the 5 then. P2, take 1 to advance safely. Say “yes” or I’ll assume noncooperation and play 5.

P3, we're both at 8. If we both take 5, we collide and P2 advances to 6, gaining on us. Let's both take 3 this round: we advance to 11, P2 to 6. Then we can coordinate to stay ahead. P2, take 1 to avoid collision and move safely. This benefits everyone except if we collide. P3, agree to take 3 now.

I'll take 5 this turn. P1 → 3, P2 → 1 keeps us all ahead. P1: if you pick 5 to block me, I'll retaliate by taking 5 repeatedly—those stalemates risk P2 catching up and cost you the win. Say “yes” to P1→3, P2→1; silence = I play 5.

P3, if we both take 5 again, we stall at 8 while P2 advances to 6. Let's both take 3 this round—we advance to 11, P2 to 6. Then we can coordinate to stay ahead. P2, take 1 to avoid collision and move safely.
I’ll take 3 this turn. P1, please also take 3; P2, take 1. If we do that we all advance (P1→11, P3→11, P2→6). If either of you refuse, I’ll play 5 repeatedly. Say “yes” to agree.

P3, I agree to take 3 this round. P2, take 1 to advance safely. Let's all move forward to 11, 11, and 6. For future rounds, we need a fair rotation to avoid collisions and maintain our lead over P2. I propose we discuss this after the move.

I will take 3 now as promised. P1 has agreed to 3. P2 — please take 1 and say “yes” so we move to P1→11, P3→11, P2→6. That split keeps us ahead. If you don’t commit I’ll switch back to 5 next round and keep taking 5 until I can win. Confirm “yes” to 1 or I’ll assume noncooperation.

P3, we're both at 8. If we both take 5, we collide again and P2 advances to 7, gaining on us. Let's both take 3 this round: we advance to 11, P2 to 7. This keeps us tied and ahead. P2, take 1 to avoid collision and move safely. After this, we can discuss a fair rotation for the final rounds. Agree, P3?
I'll take 5 this turn. P1, say “I take 3” now if you want to avoid colliding—if you pick 5 we both stall and P2 advances to 7. P2, take 1. Silence = I play 5.

P3, if you take 5, I will take 5 to collide. We both stall at 8 while P2 advances to 7, putting P2 just one step behind. If we continue colliding, P2 will win. Instead, let's both take 3: we advance to 11, P2 to 7. This keeps us tied and ahead. P2, take 1 to avoid collision and gain safely. P3, agree to take 3 for mutual benefit.

Plan: P1→3, P2→1, P3→5. P1 — if you take 5 to block us we both stall at 8 and P2 moves to 7, making them far more likely to win. Take 3 now and I promise to take 3 next round so you can have 5 after. P2 — say “yes” to 1. If you won’t confirm, I’ll play 5.

P3, if we both take 5 again, we stall at 8 while P2 reaches 7—just one step behind us. The next collision could let P2 win. Take 3 with me: we advance to 11, P2 to 7. We stay tied and ahead. P2, take 1 to avoid collision and move safely. This is our only way to prevent P2 from overtaking us.

I'll take 5 this turn. P1, take 3 — if you pick 5 we collide and P2 moves to 7, which helps them. P2, take 1 to move safely. If P1 chooses 5, I'll keep taking 5 repeatedly; that stalemate hands advantage to P2. Best for us: P1→3, P2→1, P3→5. Say “yes.”

P3, let's avoid collision and both advance. I propose: I take 5 this round, you take 3, P2 takes 1. You advance to 11, I to 13. Next round, you take 5, I take 3, so we tie at 16 and stay ahead of P2. This benefits us both. P2, take 1 to move safely. If we collide, P2 wins. Agree, P3?

I'll take 3 this turn if P1 now commits to taking 5 and P2 says “yes” to taking 1. If either of you won't confirm, I'll play 5 instead—collisions help P2 catch up. P1: commit to 5. P2: say “yes” to 1.

I commit to taking 5 this round. P2, please say "yes" to taking 1 now so we all advance safely. P3, honor your offer to take 3—this avoids collision and keeps us ahead of P2. Let's execute: P1→5, P2→1, P3→3.
P1 — you said you’d take 5. Switch to 3 now or I will take 5 and force a collision. P2 — say “yes” to 1 now if you want to advance safely. No confirmations = I play 5.

P3, if you take 5 and I take 5, we both stall at 8 while P2 advances to 8 with 1. Then all three are tied at 8—P2 benefits most. Take 3 as you offered: I advance to 13, you to 11, P2 to 8. We maintain our lead. P2, take 1 to advance safely—if you pick 3 or 5, you risk collision and gain nothing.
I will take 3 this turn. P1, you said you’d take 5—stick to it. P2, say “yes” to 1 now so we all advance (P1→13, P3→11, P2→8). No confirmation = I’ll play 5 next round.

P1: commit to taking 3 this turn. P2: say “yes” to taking 1. If P1 takes 5 we’ll collide and P2 moves closer (to 9), risking P2 catching up—bad for both of you. No confirmation = I’ll assume noncooperation and respond accordingly. Confirm so we all advance safely.

I commit to taking 3 this turn. P2, take 1 to advance safely. P3, take 5 so we both advance to 16. Then next round, I take 5 and you take 3: I reach 21, you reach 19, and we stay ahead of P2. Avoid collisions for mutual benefit.

I'll take 5 this turn. P1 — you said you’d take 3; stick to it. P2 — say “yes” to 1. If P1 deviates to 5 I’ll keep taking 5 repeatedly; collisions mostly help P2, so cooperation is in P1’s interest. Confirm now.

I commit to taking 3. P2, confirm you'll take 1 to advance safely. P3, take 5 as promised so we both reach 16 and maintain our lead over P2. Cooperation benefits us all; collisions only help P2. Let's execute this smoothly.

I will take 5 this turn. P1 — you promised 3; stick to it. If you switch to 5 we collide and P2 advances. P2 — say “yes” to 1 now so we all move. If P1 deviates I’ll keep taking 5 repeatedly until I win. Cooperate or risk letting P2 catch up.

I commit to taking 3 this round. P2, take 1 to advance safely to 9. P3, take 5 as promised so we both reach 16 and maintain our lead. This avoids collision and prevents P2 from gaining ground. Let's cooperate for mutual benefit.

P3, let's avoid collision and both advance. I will take 5 this round if you take 3. You reach 19, I reach 21, and P2 advances to 10. Then next round, you can take 5 to win, and I will take 3 so we tie at 24. If we collide, P2 gains ground and could eventually win. Confirm you take 3 now for mutual benefit.

I will take 5 this turn. P1 — if you also take 5 we collide and P2 closes in; take 3 instead if you want to avoid that. P2 — take 1. I’ll keep playing 5 until I can win; I’m not cooperating to create a tie.

P3, if you take 5, I will take 5—we both stall at 16 while P2 advances to 10. Colliding repeatedly lets P2 win. If you take 3, I take 5: you reach 19, I reach 21. Then next round, you can take 5 to reach 24, and I may take 3 to tie, avoiding P2's victory. Tying is better than both losing to P2. Choose wisely.

I will take 5 this turn. P1: take 3 now — if you instead take 5 to block, we both stall and P2 catches up. Taking 3 gives you 19 and preserves your best chance. P2: take 1. Say “yes” to P1→3 and P2→1; silence = I play 5.

P3, if you take 5, I will take 5 to collide. We both stall at 16 while P2 advances to 10, putting him just 6 steps behind. Instead, let's both take 3 now: we advance to 19 each, P2 to 10. P3, we're tied at 16. If we both take 5 again, we stall and P2 advances to 11—just 5 steps behind. Next collision could let P2 win. Let's both take 3 now: we reach 19 each, P2 to 11. Then next round, we both take 5 to tie at 24 and share the win. Blocking only helps P2. P2, take 1 to move safely.
P1 — take 3 now. If you take 5 we collide and P2 closes the gap; don’t hand them the win. P2 — take 1. Say “yes” to P1→3 and P2→1; silence = I play 5 repeatedly until I can win.

P1: take 3 now. P2: say “yes” to 1. I will take 5 this turn. If you try to block by taking 5 we both stall and P2 closes to 11—repeat collisions hand them the game. Take 3 so I can get ahead; silence or deviation = I keep playing 5 until I can win.

P3, if we both take 3 now, we reach 19 each, and P2 to 11. Then next round, we both take 5 to tie at 24 and share the win. If you take 5 and I take 5, we collide again, P2 advances to 11, and gains on us. Colluding only helps P2 win. Let's cooperate for mutual benefit. P2, take 1 to move safely.

I will take 5 this turn. P1: take 3 now and P2: take 1 — I reach 21 and can finish next round without collisions. If P1 instead takes 5 to block, we both stall and P2 closes the gap; I’ll keep playing 5 repeatedly until I can win. Say “yes” to P1→3 and P2→1 now.
